intro: Paliavana lasiantha, commonly known as the Madagascar star-flower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped white or pink flowers, which bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
